description.narrative: The revised PDO is to support Mongolian Small and Medium size firms (SMEs) in the non-mining sector to strengthen their expert capabilities, expand access to export markets and to provide relief support for the COVID-19 recovery.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Mid Term Review | Description :The Recipient and the Project Implementing Entity to (i) carry out a mid-termreview of the Project and prepare and furnish to the Association a mid-term report documenting progress achieved in the carryingout of the Project and setting out the measures recommended to ensure the continued efficient carrying out of the Project and theachievement of its objective; and (ii) review with the Association such mid-term report. | Due Date :30-Sep-2018

Finance Agreement :Project steering committee | Description :Recipient to establish one month after the Effectiveness date, thelatest, and maintain a Project steering committee with a mandate, composition, staffing and resources satisfactory to theAssociation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguards | Description :Recipient and Project Implementing Entity to carry out the Project in accordance withthe environmental and social standards, mitigation arrangements, assessments, plans, and other requirements set forth in theEnvironmental and Social Management Framework. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Matching Grants Replaced with Productive Partnership Scheme
The Recipient shall, by no later than September 15, 2020, update the Project Implementation Manual in a manner satisfactory to theAssociation.

title.narrative: Number of Export Credit Insurance Products developed by Mongolian Re
Number of firms benefiting from export insurance products (cumulative)
Number of firms that obtain internationally-recognized quality certification following support from the Project(cumulative, disaggregated by the number of firms owned by women)

Number of firms that start exporting following participation in project activities (cumulative, disaggregated by the number of firms owned by women)
Beneficiaries that feel project investments reflected their needs
Number of clusters supported by the Productive Partnership Scheme
Number of new export destinations for the project beneficiaries
Number of SMEs benefiting from accredited reference laboratories supported by the Project
Number of SMEs supported by the COVID-19 measure
Total unemployment insurance contribution payments made to non-mining SMEs
